ngiemboon: Nandab pɔ́ Ambiyu pie é laa penkʉ́ Áloŋ pembàŋa, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b kaa tàʼ tàʼ múɔ tétɔ́ʼ ńnéŋ mmɔ̌g tsoló, ńzába lìi ndumó, ńdɔg wɛ̌ mmɔ̌g gẅie é té we Ssé wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ gẅie Ssé la te cʉ́me mbwó pɔ́b wɔ́, ńtóo mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Aaron’s sons Nadab   and Abihu  # 10:1 Ex 24:1 each took his own firepan,  # 10:1 Ex 27:3; 38:3; 1Kg 7:50; 2Kg 25:15; Jr 52:19 put fire in it, placed incense on it,  # 10:1 Ex 30:7–9; Lv 16:12; Nm 16:17,46 and presented unauthorized  # 10:1 Ex 30:9; Nm 3:4; 26:61; Jr 2:25; 3:13; Hs 5:7 fire before the Lord, which he had not commanded them to do.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, etsɔ́ mmɔ̌g kẅɛɛ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ḿbú ńtuɔ wɔ́b, tà pɔ́ pú ńkwéte mvfò yé.
en: Then fire came from the Lord    and consumed them, and they died before the Lord.  # 10:2 Nm 26:61; Dt 4:24; 2Sm 6:7

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê gɔɔn mbwó Áloŋ ngie: Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka gɔɔn á yɔɔn: Mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo ngie pʉ̀a pie é sẅɛ́ʼte né lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, zsé ngie mèŋ zɔɔ ndàʼ Ssé ye nénʉ́, pɔ́ piŋ ńná mekùʼ mɔ́ɔn á mvfò láʼ ntsèm, Áloŋ láŋte.
en: Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the Lord has spoken:

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê lǎʼ ńtóŋo Mikayɛɛ pɔ́ Ɛtsafaŋ pie ée penkʉ́ Uziyɛɛ gẅie á laa métá tá pa Áloŋ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó éfó jʉʼ gie áa ye Ssé ńkẅile mefɛ̌ pí, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa né jʉʼ gie mé těen ńtsẅé wó wɔ́.
en: Moses summoned Mishael and Elzaphan,   sons of Aaron’s uncle Uzziel,  # 10:4 Nm 3:19 and said to them, “Come here and carry your relatives away from the front of the sanctuary to a place outside the camp.”  # 10:4 Lv 8:17; Heb 13:11–13

ngiemboon: Mé kaa wɔ́b laa menzsǒ fàʼ mɔ́b ńdɔg fó jʉʼ gie mé tsẅé wó ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa páʼ Mǒonsê la tsẅi.
en: So they came forward and carried them in their tunics outside the camp, as Moses had said.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê gɔɔn mbwó Áloŋ mbɔɔ mbwó Eleyazaa pɔ́ Etamaa pie ée penkʉ́ Áloŋ ngie: Tà pi nyé twó sí té syɛ́b, tà pi ké shʉate menzsǒ mí, á fʉ̀ʼ gie legwé kẅɛ̌ɛ na pi; à cʉa púʼu pi é le gÿo ńkwé wɔ́, pi piŋ le lyɛ́bte gyáŋalóŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńnéŋe na láʼa ntsèm wɔ́. Mefɛ̌ pi lâ tsìŋendá Ésàlayɛ ntsèm ge táa ne lʉa ńtí mmɔ̌g gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka kweʼé.
en: Then Moses said to Aaron and his sons Eleazar and Ithamar,   “Do not let your hair hang loose  # 10:6 Lv 13:45; 21:10; Nm 5:18; Jdg 5:2 and do not tear your clothes,  # 10:6 Lv 21:10; Mk 14:63 or else you will die, and the Lord will become angry  # 10:6 Ex 16:20 with the whole community. However, your brothers, the whole house of Israel, may weep  # 10:6 Gn 37:34 over the fire that the Lord caused.

ngiemboon: Pi těen ńdáʼa fóo ncwò ntàb mbumté ńkẅɛɛ wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ pi ge kwéte; á nue mé la pfɛte mevɛ́ lɔg ńzɔ́ʼ twó sí, ńdɔgɔ gẅí ńgÿo pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: You must not go outside the entrance to the tent of meeting or you will die, for the Lord’s anointing oil   is on you.” So they did as Moses said.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅii mbwó Áloŋ ngie:
en: The Lord spoke to Aaron:

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ gie pi lâ ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù ntsèm ge láʼ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb mbumté, pi le láʼ ńnú melùʼ wɔ́, mbɔɔ mé ntʉtʉ; á cʉa púʼu pi le kwéte; e lɔg ńgwɔ́ lepʉ̌ sie é ge láʼa tsẅé gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó na mejwoŋó mejwoŋó.
en: “You and your sons are not to drink wine   or beer  # 10:9 Nm 6:3–4; Dt 7:13; 11:14; Jdg 13:4; Pr 20:1; Ezk 44:21; Dn 1:3–16; 10:3; Am 2:12; Mk 4:23–25; Lk 1:15; Jn 2:1–11; Rm 14:21; 1Tm 3:3,8 when you enter the tent of meeting, or else you will die; this is a permanent statute  # 10:9 Ex 28:43; Lv 11:46 throughout your generations.

ngiemboon: Tà pi nú melùʼ ntʉtʉ, tá à cʉa púʼu, pi lɔg ńzsé léfaga mmó gie áa ye Ssé pɔ́ gie á té ye Ssé wɔ́, mbɔɔ mmó ncÿǒ pɔ́ gie á té ye ncÿǒ wɔ́,
en: You must distinguish   between the holy and the common,  # 10:10 Ezk 22:26; 42:20; 44:23; 48:15; Ac 10:28 and the clean and the unclean,  # 10:10 Lv 11:4; Nm 19:13

ngiemboon: tá ńdɔg ńzíʼi pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ mentÿɔgɔ́ ntsèm mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la cʉa na Mǒonsê ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b.
en: and teach the Israelites all the statutes   that the Lord has given to them through Moses.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê tsẅii mbwó Áloŋ, tà mbɔɔ Eleyazaa pɔ́ Etamaa, é penkʉ́ pé pie à la nyé ńgẅiin ngie: Pi kaa pfwɔ̀ʼɔ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé lagá nkáʼ, é pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ tà é pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿpfɛ́ té mvòŋ, á ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ: Mélàʼmie áa kwàʼ mmó gie áa ye Ssé.
en: Moses spoke to Aaron and his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar: “Take the grain offering that is left over from the food offerings   to the Lord, and eat it prepared without yeast beside the altar, because it is especially holy.

ngiemboon: Pi ge pfɛ́ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼ gie áa ye Ssé: Ée ssé ńgwɔ́ ntÿɔgɔ́ gẅie mé nǎa mbwó gù mbɔɔ mbwó penkʉ́ pú, á na pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ tà é pú shÿó, ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; é lepʉ̌ sie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la náa mbwó mèŋ.
en: You must eat it in a holy place because it is your portion   and your sons’ from the food offerings to the Lord, for this is what I was commanded.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pi ge láʼa pfɛ́ɛ jʉʼ gie áa ye Ssé, pi lâ penkʉ́ pú pembàŋa mbɔɔ pé panzwě: Kékʉ́b gẅie mé kweʼé ńnáa tÿó mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ ntɔ́ɔn gẅie mé kẅilé, á na shúm pwɔʼ mbʉ́lè pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, sɛ̌ shúm ŋwɛ́ ée sie mé la ná né pi, ḿbiŋ ńŋweʼe ńná né pi lâ penkʉ́ pú.
en: But you and your sons and your daughters may eat the breast of the presentation offering and the thigh of the contribution in any ceremonially clean place, because these portions have been assigned to you and your children from the Israelites’ fellowship sacrifices.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ge lɔg ntɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ kékʉ́b gẅie mé kweʼé ńnáa tÿó mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgÿo mefóon mie mé ge túɔ tà é pú shÿó, e lɔg tó á jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, afʉ̀ʼ gie mé pǔ ńkwéʼe ńnáa tÿó mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la, mejʉʼ mbab ŋwɛ́ e cʉ́ʼ mú, lâ me penkʉ́ pú pembàŋa ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la záb ngie aa láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu.
en: They are to bring the thigh of the contribution and the breast of the presentation offering, together with the food offerings of the fat portions, to present as a presentation offering before the Lord. It will belong permanently   to you and your children, as the Lord commanded.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê faʼa fÿɛ̀ we mmó pwɔʼ lɔg ńdúɔ mefʉa, ńjúʼ ngie mé ka tuɔ. Ńdeen ńké ńgyáŋa lóŋ na Eleyazaa pɔ́ Etamaa pie pɔ́b lâ penkʉ́ Áloŋ pembàŋa pie é la nyé wó, ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Then Moses inquired carefully about the male goat of the sin offering, but it had already been burned up. He was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s surviving sons, and asked,

ngiemboon: Ńtí kɔ́ pí ka te pfɛ́ɛ mmó pwɔʼ lɔg ńdúɔ mefʉa á jʉʼ gie áa ye Ssé wɔ́? Áa kwàʼ mmó gie áa ndʉalʉ̌a: À lɔ̌ɔn ńnáa né pi páʼ pi zɔ ge lɔgɔ lépfɛ́, é lɔg kaa menò tepòŋ mɔ́b é pìʼ, púʼu, é lɔg véle mefʉa láʼ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: “Why didn’t you eat the sin offering in the sanctuary area?   For it is especially holy, and he has assigned it to you to take away the guilt  # 10:17 Nm 5:31 of the community  # 10:17 Ex 28:38; Hs 14:2; Jn 1:29 and make atonement for them before the Lord.

ngiemboon: Mé la te lɔg metse ńtó tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntàb wɔ́. Pi kɔ̌ɔn ńge pfɛ́ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼ gie áa ndʉalʉ̌a páʼ mèŋ n da tsẅi púʼu.
en: Since its blood was not brought inside the sanctuary, you should have eaten it in the sanctuary area, as I commanded.”

ngiemboon: Áloŋ gɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ mmó pwɔʼ yɔ́b ye lɔg ńdúɔ mefʉa, pɔ́ mmó pwɔʼ gie mé tuɔ tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ńtóo mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn. Táʼ, n daa péʼe ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó pwɔʼ lɔg ńdúɔ mefʉa ńtí menò mie é la kúu wɔ́ɔn, mbà áa lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn ne ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a?
en: But Aaron replied to Moses, “See, today they presented their sin offering and their burnt offering before the Lord. Since these things have happened to me, if I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been acceptable in the Lord’s sight? ”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê júʼ yɔɔn ntí lɔg ńtsɔ́ʼ, á poŋo yé.
en: When Moses heard this, it was acceptable to him.
